command.description: The command-line string to be executed. It can contain placeholders in the form of '{paramName}' which correspond to parameters defined in the input schema.

templateVariables.description:
Defines how input parameters are formatted into the command string.
The map key corresponds to the parameter name from the input schema.

CliInvocationConfig.description: CliInvocationConfig is the configuration for executing a command-line tool.

from.description: From specifies the invocation base to extend from.

extend.description: Extend adds or merges new fields into the base configuration (e.g., append to arrays, merge maps).

override.description: Override replaces fields in the base configuration with new values.

remove.description: Remove deletes specific fields from the base configuration (e.g., remove map keys, clear strings).

ExtendsConfig.description: ExtendsConfig allows extending an invocation base with modifications.

url.description:
The URL for the HTTP request.

It can contain placeholders in the form of {paramName} which correspond to parameters from the input schema.
It can contain placeholders in the form of {headers.paramName} which correspond to headers from the incoming
http request (won't work in stdio).
It can contain placeholders in the form of ${ENV_VAR_NAME} or {env.ENV_VAR_NAME} which correspond to env vars

headers.description:
The headers for the HTTP request.

Values can contain placeholders in the form of {paramName} which correspond to parameters from the input schema.
Values can contain placeholders in the form of {headers.paramName} which correspond to headers from the incoming
http request (won't work in stdio).
Values can contain placeholders in the form of ${ENV_VAR_NAME} or {env.ENV_VAR_NAME} which correspond to env vars

method.description: The HTTP method to be used for the request (e.g., "GET", "POST").

bodyRoot.description:
BodyRoot specifies a dot-separated path to a property whose value should be used as the HTTP request body.
This allows sending non-object request bodies, despite MCP requiring all tool call params to be rooted in
a top-level object.
Mutually exclusive with BodyAsArray

bodyAsArray.description:
BodyAsArray wraps the entire request body into a JSON array.
For example, if the arguments are {"name": "foo"}, the HTTP body will be [{"name": "foo"}].
This is useful for APIs that expect array inputs but you want to expose a simpler single-item interface.
Mutually exclusive with BodyRoot.

HttpInvocationConfig.description: HttpInvocationConfig is the configuration for making an HTTP request.

additionalProperties.description: Invocation configuration with exactly one type key (http, cli, or extends)

type.description: The type of the value. Can be a single type or an array of types.

properties.description: An object where each key is a property name and each value is a schema.

required.description: An array of required property names.

additionalProperties.description: Whether additional properties are allowed (boolean) or a schema they must match (object).

items.description: Schema for array items. Can be a single schema or an array of schemas for tuple validation.

description.description: A description of the schema's purpose.

title.description: A short title for the schema.

default.description: The default value for this schema.

const.description: A constant value that must match exactly.

$ref.description: A reference to another schema definition (e.g., '#/$defs/MyType').

$defs.description: A container for reusable schema definitions.

definitions.description: Legacy container for reusable schema definitions. Use $defs instead.

allOf.description: Must match all of the schemas in the array.

anyOf.description: Must match at least one of the schemas in the array.

oneOf.description: Must match exactly one of the schemas in the array.

multipleOf.description: Value must be a multiple of this number.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern that strings must match.

minItems.description: Minimum number of items in arrays.

maxItems.description: Maximum number of items in arrays.

uniqueItems.description: Whether array items must be unique.

minProperties.description: Minimum number of properties in objects.

maxProperties.description: Maximum number of properties in objects.

patternProperties.description: Schemas for properties matching regex patterns.

format.description:
Template is the format string for the variable. It can be a simple string or contain template variables like '{paramName}'.
For example, "--user={username}" or "--verbose".

omitIfFalse.description:
OmitIfFalse, if true, causes the template to be omitted entirely if the input
value is a boolean `false`. This is useful for optional flags like "--force".

TemplateVariable.description: TemplateVariable is the formatting for a single parameter in the command template.
